docs.snippet: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon of the United Nations accused Syria of failing to carry out a peace plan, and Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton hinted at a NATO role....
docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon of the United Nations accused Syria of failing to carry out a peace plan, and Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton hinted at a NATO role.
docs.abstract: International pressure for a harsher line on Syria escalates after new reports of violence there, with Pres Nicolas Sarkozy of France calling Pres Bashar al-Assad of Syria a liar, Sec of State Hillary Clinton moving a step closer to endorsing use of military force, and United Nations Sec General Ban Ki-moon accusing the Syrian government of failing to carry out a peace plan.

headline.seo: Syria Accused of Failing to Live Up to Peace Plan
headline.main: Pressure Builds for Tougher Line as Syria Is Said to Shun Peace Plan
headline.print_headline: Pressure Builds for Tougher Line as Syria Is Said to Shun Peace Plan

docs.snippet: Murray Cook, the Yankees' general manager, has apparently completed his period of penance.    Members of the Yankee organization have talked for the past two weeks about how George Steinbrenner, the principal owner, ordered Cook to stay in New Yor...
docs.lead_paragraph: Murray Cook, the Yankees' general manager, has apparently completed his period of penance. Members of the Yankee organization have talked for the past two weeks about how George Steinbrenner, the principal owner, ordered Cook to stay in New York instead of going to spring training in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., as punishment for the club's loss of Tim Belcher to the Oakland A's from the free-agent compensation pool.

byline.original: By Thomas Rogers and Murray Chass
